Uh-huh.  I've heard that story plenty of times, bub.  And it's always 
a flat-out LIE.

Now that you've seen my knee-jerk opinion of your arguement, how 
about something a little more thoughtful ...

Let me remind you that I DID put a cap on the weapon's firing rate - 
albeit belatedly.  Not to mention Wheeljack-X isn't the type of 
fellow to take advantage of a stasis-locked bot unless they did 
something to REALLY tick him off, which is a legendary feat in and of 
itself.  Depending on the size of the character, and the relative 
vulnerability to magnetism (there IS a difference between bots in 
that regard, see below), and of course individual tendencies to allow 
damage to characters, it could take three shots, or six, or ten, 
etc.  This is the same with most other weapons, you know.

As I said, individual bots may have different susceptibility to 
magnetic fields.  Those with plasma-based weapons are in real 
trouble, as are those with more sophisticated circuitry.  (In case 
you didn't know, plasma is easily affected by magnetism.)

And a quick physics lesson for those who are in dire need of such 
education: an electromagnetic pulse (EMP) is a rapidly-spreading 
burst along most or all of the electromagnetic spectrum.  A magnetic 
field (note the obvious terminology difference: pulse vs field) is a 
set of force lines that loop back on themselves - affecting only a 
few parts of the same spectrum.

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "warriorazure" <wingedwarrior41@h...> wrote:
> Look, the main reason I asked to hold firing your new weapon was 
> because I was not certain of wether it was in the bounds of 
legality 
> or not. The way I saw it was that the weapon could send a bot to 
> stasis lock in no time. We'd like to keep this rpg as fair to 
everyone 
> as possible. That's all and there's no reason to say we don't like 
new 
> ideas just because of that.
